title: Lindsey Graham and the business of war
content: The senator from South Carolina has spent three decades advocating aggressive intervention as the solution to international problems. No wonder Trump's rhetoric is music to his ears. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Serge Halimi

title: ‘Wines of Israel' – produced on Palestinian land
content: Seizing Palestinian land, planting vines and mislabelling their wines as ‘Product of Israel' has become common among Israeli settler winemakers. International buyers continue to turn a blind eye. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Meriem Laribi & Marta Vidal

title: Japan's new prime minister raises the stakes
content: For decades, the LDP delivered enough prosperity and stability for the Japanese to accept a one-party state. Now, the ideological malleability that long sustained it is turning into something harder. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Emil Pacha Valencia

title: Turkey and the politics of genocide denial
content: Asserting that the Ottoman empire perpetrated a genocide of its Armenian citizens in 1915 remains prohibited under Turkey's penal code. Denial prevents the state's founding myth from unravelling. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Razmig Keucheyan

title: The end of empathy
content: World leaders are keen to move on from Gaza, to call it a solved problem. But this is not an exception: shelving suffering and erasing ‘awkward' peoples, has become a defining logic of our time. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Peter Harling

title: An ambiguous international order
content: January 1942 Declaration by United Nations (originally signed by 26 countries including the US, UK and China) confirms commitment to pursue war against the Axis powers November 1943 Cairo declaration (US, UK and China) sets out principles for the postwar world order February 1945 Yalta conference (US, UK and USSR) outlines the campaign against Japan and the postwar world order July 1945 Potsdam declaration (US, UK and USSR) dictates terms for Japan's surrender September 1951 Treaty (…) - 2026/02...
creator: Renaud Lambert

title: Japan's dangerous game with China
content: Japan's postwar constitution renounces war ‘forever'. But with fears that US actions in Venezuela could embolden China to seize Taiwan, Sanae Takaichi could be tempted into a risky game. - 2026/02 / article , 2026/02 Japan
creator: Renaud Lambert

title: Europe's strategic bind over Ukraine
content: By prolonging a war that cannot be fought without the US, Europe has placed itself squarely in Washington's hands. At what price? - 2026/02 / article
creator: Hélène Richard

title: US: an old-new imperial doctrine
content: The United States has grown wary of longterm occupations. Abandoning the pretence of exporting democracy, the Trump administration has chosen to force existing powers to comply with its rule. - 2026/02 / article
creator: Gilbert Achcar

title: Iran in the eye of the storm
content: Brutal repression of protests in recent weeks has exposed an Iranian regime that is almost out of options. And foreign interference is increasing the pressure on national unity and regional stability. - 2026/02 / article , 2026/02 four powers
creator: Marmar Kabir

title: Why Trump's Greenland fixation?
content: Donald Trump has staked his capricious claim to Greenland on the grounds of national security, access to minerals – and ‘psychological need'. But behind his fixation lies a neo-imperial mindset. - 2026/02 / article , 2026/02 war
creator: Philippe Descamps

title: America unbound, Europe sidelined
content: Donald Trump's recent actions have laid bare the EU's weakness. Its leaders' knee-jerk calls for ‘more Europe' will only strengthen Washington's hand. - 2026/02 / article , 2026/02 war , 2026/02 war weapons
creator: Benoît Bréville

title: World on the brink
content: A largescale war is looming, warn a significant number of Cassandras, politicians, researchers, senior army officers and journalists, based on the chaos of the past year. ‘I've reported on more than 40 wars around the world during my career, which goes back to the 1960s. I watched the cold war reach its height, then simply evaporate. But I've never seen a year quite as worrying as 2025,' writes John Simpson, the BBC's world affairs editor . The Council on Foreign Relations says the number of (…)...
creator: Akram Belkaïd

title: Looking back at Venezuela's Bolivarian revolution
content: The kidnapping of Nicolás Maduro on the night of 2-3 January 2026 did not so much mark Venezuela's return to the international stage as serve as a reminder that the country has never stopped being a major strategic asset. Washington now seems determined to place Venezuela and its natural resources under its control and to pull the country away from its alliances with China, Iran and Russia. In Caracas, Delcy Rodríguez, acting president of the Caribbean nation in Maduro's absence, stated: ‘We (…)...
